marketNews.title: MSCI: BREN, PTRO, and CUAN Will Not Enter February 2025 Review
marketNews.content: MSCI announced that Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN), and Petrosea (PTRO) will not be included in the MSCI Indonesia Investable Market Index in the February 2025 review following analysis and input regarding potential investability constraints. The announcement for the February 2025 MSCI index review is scheduled for February 11, 2025. Responding to this issue, BREN President Director, Hendra Tan, stated that MSCI's decision is entirely the index provider's authority and outside the company's control. Hendra mentioned that BREN's focus remains on delivering sustainable growth. Previously, BREN was removed from the FTSE Global Equity Series - Large Cap index by FTSE Russell on September 19, 2024, only one month after the announcement of its inclusion in the index, due to hitting the free float rule because of high shareholder concentration, where 97% of the total issued shares were only held by 4 shareholders. BREN's stock price subsequently dropped -34% from the level of 11,025 rupiah per share on September 19, 2024, to 7,225 rupiah per share on September 22, 2024. Nevertheless, BREN provided clarification to the IDX on September 22, 2024, stating that the number of shares meeting the free float requirement based on IDX provisions amounted to 15.6 billion shares or equivalent to 11.66% of the shares outstanding as of September 19, 2024. This amount did not show a significant change compared to the free float portion based on the IPO prospectus of 11.73%. Following MSCI's announcement today, Friday (7/2), the three stocks closed lower, with BREN at -19.94%, CUAN at -19.96%, and PTRO at -24.61%. Key Takeaway: MSCI mentioned that they will still review the eligibility of these stocks as part of future index reviews and will provide further communication as needed.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Denies the 13th and 14th Salary for Civil Servants Will Be Abolished, God Willing It Will Be Disbursed
marketNews.content: Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani, on Thursday (6/2) denied the rumor that the 13th and 14th salaries for civil servants (PNS) would be abolished. The rumor about the loss of the 13th and 14th PNS salaries emerged after President Prabowo Subianto instructed efficiency in state spending in the 2025 State Budget (APBN) and Regional Budget (APBD) implementation to save state cash up to 306.7 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Minister of Public Works Dody Hanggodo Says 21 Infrastructure Projects Affected by Budget Cuts, Here is the List
marketNews.content: Minister of Public Works, Dody Hanggodo, stated on Thursday (6/2) that at least 21 infrastructure development projects will be forced to be postponed due to budget efficiency in 2025, including connectivity, water resources, and settlement area projects. On the same day, Dody also mentioned that the development of the Nusantara Capital City (IKN) has seen no progress because the budget is still blocked by the Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, due to efficiency instructions from President Prabowo Subianto. This budget efficiency caused the budget for the Ministry of Public Works for 2025 to drop from 81.38 trillion rupiah to only 29.57 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Developers Urge Government to Immediately Realize 2025 FLPP Program
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the developers association, Real Estat Indonesia, urged the government to immediately speed up the realization of the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP) disbursement because subsidized housing developers are starting to experience cash flow difficulties. The Chairman of the Central Executive Board of Real Estat Indonesia, Joko Suranto, stated that currently, 17,000 subsidized houses have been built by developers but cannot yet proceed with credit agreements because the government has not realized the FLPP funds. The government has budgeted 28.27 trillion rupiah for the FLPP program in 2025 to finance 220,000 subsidized housing units. However, the government is currently working on a scheme to change the FLPP funding composition to 50% borne by the State Budget (APBN) and 50% from banking liquidity—changing from the existing scheme where 75% is borne by APBN and 25% from bank liquidity—so that the number of subsidized houses that can be financed increases to 330,000 units.

marketNews.title: Health Partnerships with USAID Held, Minister Says
marketNews.content: Minister of Health, Budi Gunadi Sadikin, stated on Thursday (6/2) that health partnerships between Indonesia and the US are currently suspended in line with US President Donald Trump's plan to implement efficiency measures for the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) humanitarian agency. Budi mentioned that the freezing of foreign aid from the US to Indonesia could burden Indonesia's efforts to tackle HIV and tuberculosis, which replaced COVID-19 as the leading cause of infectious disease deaths globally in 2023. Budi also said that it is still unclear whether aid from USAID to Indonesia will be suspended permanently. In November 2024, the US Embassy in Indonesia stated that USAID had invested 800 million US dollars in Indonesia since 2020.

marketNews.title: Government to Provide Free Health Checks Starting February 10, 2025
marketNews.content: Minister of Health, Budi Gunadi Sadikin, stated on Thursday (6/2) that the government will provide free health checks starting on February 10, 2025, with a budget of approximately 3 trillion rupiah. The program targets 220 million people in 2025. Budi claimed that the free health check program is the largest health program ever carried out by the government, surpassing COVID-19 vaccinations.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Aims for 2.5 Million Vehicle Production by 2030
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, stated on Thursday (6/2) that the government targets total domestic vehicle production to reach 2.5 million units by 2030, in line with the acceleration of electric vehicle (EV) adoption towards the net zero emission target in 2060. This target is more than double the 2024 vehicle production realization of approximately 1.2 million units.

marketNews.title: Thailand Prepares Draft Strategic Plan for Semiconductor Industry
marketNews.content: Secretary General of the Thai Investment Council, Narit Therdsteerasukdi, told Reuters on Thursday (6/2) that Thailand plans to prepare an initial draft of a strategic plan for the semiconductor industry within the next 90 days. Narit also mentioned that they are working on a roadshow to the US and Japan to raise investment funds for the semiconductor sector in Thailand. According to a 2024 report by consulting firm A. T. Kearney, Thailand ranks second after India in the analysis of top emerging economies for semiconductor manufacturing. Thailand targets new investment in the semiconductor sector by 2029 to reach 500 billion baht or 14.8 billion US dollars.

tickerNews.title: MDKA FY24: Gold Sales Volume -16.5% YoY, Copper +9% YoY
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA) recorded gold production volume of 35,824 ounces in 4Q24 (+17.3% QoQ, +21.4% YoY), with gold sales volume of 29,056 ounces (+4.6% QoQ, -6.8% YoY). Meanwhile, copper production volume reached 3,419 tons in 4Q24 (-10.3% QoQ, +0.6% YoY), and copper sales volume was 3,101 tons (-37.6% QoQ, +40.6% YoY). These results brought the total gold and copper production volume for 2024 to 115,867 ounces (-16.4% YoY) and 13,902 tons (+9.4% YoY) respectively, in line with management guidance. Meanwhile, gold and copper sales volume throughout 2024 reached 108,471 ounces (-16.5% YoY) and 14,411 tons (+9% YoY) respectively. MDKA also announced 2025 guidance with gold production volume around 100,000-110,000 ounces and copper production volume around 11,000-13,000 tons.

tickerNews.title: MBMA FY24 Nickel Ore Production Hits Milestones, Issues 2025 Guidance
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials (MBMA) recorded limonite nickel ore production volume of 3.4 million wmt in 4Q24 (-8.1% QoQ, +110% YoY), with saprolite nickel ore production volume of 3 million wmt (+200% QoQ, +108% YoY). Nickel pig iron production volume reached 18,823 tons in 4Q24 (+35.4% QoQ, -16.2% YoY), with high-grade nickel matte production volume of 11,893 tons (-9.8% QoQ, +1.6% YoY). These results brought nickel pig iron and high-grade nickel matte production throughout 2024 to 82,161 tons (+26.2% YoY) and 50,315 tons (+65.9% YoY) respectively. MBMA also announced 2025 guidance with limonite sales volume around 12.5-15 million wmt, saprolite sales volume around 6-7 million wmt, nickel pig iron sales volume around 80,000-87,000 tons, and high-grade nickel matte sales volume around 50,000-55,000 tons.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Commissioner Erwin Ciputra Acquires 500,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) Commissioner, Erwin Ciputra, purchased 500,000 PTRO shares at an average price of 3,950 rupiah per share on February 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Erwin Ciputra's ownership increased from 0.0729% to 0.0779%.

tickerNews.title: KPIG Ordered to Temporarily Halt Lido SEZ Construction Due to Water and Environmental Management Issues
tickerNews.content: The Ministry of Environment ordered MNC Land (KPIG) to temporarily halt the construction of the Lido Special Economic Zone (KEK) project in Bogor Regency, West Java, due to issues with water and environmental management, where the ministry stated that mismanagement in the project caused sedimentation in Lake Lido. Responding to this, KPIG stated that the sedimentation occurred before the company took over the Lido area in 2013. Deputy for Law Enforcement of the Ministry of Environment, Rizal Irawan, said that the government provides a grace period of 90 days for KPIG to comply with the given recommendations, otherwise it will face criminal or civil sanctions. The Lido KEK began in 2016 and collaborated with the Trump Organization since 2019, but several projects within it were only inaugurated in 2H24 due to delays caused by the pandemic.

tickerNews.title: BIRD Targets Double-Digit Revenue Growth and Significant EV Fleet Expansion in 2025
tickerNews.content: Blue Bird (BIRD) President Director, Adrianto Djokosoetono, stated that the company targets double-digit revenue growth throughout 2025, although he did not specify further. Adrianto also mentioned that BIRD will undertake significant expansion in its electric vehicle (EV) fleet, targeting an additional 1,000 electric vehicles in 2025. Of this number, 500 electric vehicles will be realized in 1H25. According to a Bloomberg report, BIRD's total fleet reached 23,000 vehicles by the end of 2023, with 1% of them being electric vehicles.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Collaborates with Chinese Firm to Develop Coal Downstreaming Products for EV Batteries
tickerNews.content: MIND ID Corporate Portfolio and Business Development Director, Dilo Seno Widagdo, stated that through Bukit Asam (PTBA), they have established cooperation with Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. to develop coal downstream products in the form of synthetic graphite, which is a component in the production of lithium-ion batteries for electric vehicles (EVs). PTBA is currently conducting research on synthetic graphite prototypes together with the National Research and Innovation Agency (BRIN), with commercial production expected to commence in 2028.

tickerNews.title: SIDO President Director David Hidayat Acquired 905,700 Shares
tickerNews.content: Sido Muncul (SIDO) President Director, David Hidayat, purchased 905,700 SIDO shares at an average price of 575 rupiah per share on February 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 521 million rupiah. After this transaction, David Hidayat's ownership in SIDO increased from none previously to 0.003%.

tickerNews.title: IMAS Shareholder PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa Sold 40 Million Shares for Reverse Repo
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Sukses Internasional (IMAS) shareholder, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa, sold 40 million IMAS shares at an average price of 513 rupiah per share on January 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 20.5 billion rupiah and was intended for a reverse repo. After this transaction, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa's ownership in IMAS decreased from 6.6% previously to 5.6%.

tickerNews.title: PGEO and Pertagas Sign Joint Study Agreement to Explore Green Hydrogen and Ammonia Development
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) signed a joint study agreement with a subsidiary of Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS), PT Pertamina Gas (Pertagas), to collaborate on exploring the development of green hydrogen and green ammonia. The cooperation will cover technical information exchange and collaboration in conducting technical studies such as project feasibility evaluation and identifying schemes for utilizing geothermal electricity to produce green hydrogen and green ammonia. After the technical study is completed, PGEO and Pertagas will proceed to a feasibility study to review various aspects of the project, including potential investment and business scheme development, resource allocation, selection of appropriate technology, and implementation timeline. This cooperative project will be implemented in the geothermal working areas managed by PGEO, considering locations that have optimal potential to support the production of green hydrogen and green ammonia.

tickerNews.title: WSKT Recorded New Contract Value of IDR 9.6 Trillion in 2024
tickerNews.content: Waskita Karya (WSKT) recorded a new contract value of 9.6 trillion rupiah in 2024 (-43.2% YoY). WSKT Corporate Secretary, Ermy Puspa Yunita, said that this new contract value was achieved amidst the company's financial streamlining and limited tender activity throughout last year.
